help.question: Can I select data for multiple boundaries?
help.answer: Right now, you can only download data for one boundary at a time, but can put in multiple requests to get data on additional regions. We hope to improve this functionality in later releases.

help.question: What format will I receive data in?
help.answer: We will email you a CSV for use in common programs (Excel, STATA, SPSS, etc), shape boundary information if you prefer use in GIS programs, and a PDF metadata file.

help.question: How do I cite data I receive from this tool?
help.answer: You should cite both the individual data products you receive (details are provided in the metadata) as well as this tool: Goodman, S., BenYishay, A., Runfola, D., 2017. Overview of the geo Framework. AidData. Available online athttp://geo.aiddata.org/. DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.28363.59686

help.question: Do I need to cite individual datasets?
help.answer: Yes. The documentation provided with your results will include citation and source information for individual datasets. These should be used along with a citation for geo.query

help.question: How long will it take to receive my data?
help.answer: This is highly dependent on the data requested. Many requests will be nearly instantaneous due to preprocessing and data caching, however requests which require processing may take up to several hours per aid permutation request (if selection has large number of project locations).

help.question: Where can I go to provide feedback or request new datasets?
help.answer: We have an online form you can access HERE

help.question: How can I contact you directly?
Do you have examples of the types of analyses that can be conducted using this data?
help.answer: Yes - we provide a number of examples at geo.aiddata.org.

help.question: Do you conduct research using this information?
help.answer: Yes, we work with a wide range of organizations to analyze spatial information. Many examples can be seen at geo.aiddata.org; you can also contact us at geo@aiddata.wm.edu.

help.question: How do I submit my request?
help.answer: Click the Submit Request at the upper-right then enter your email and click the big Submit button.

help.question: Can I edit/update/resubmit previous requests?
help.answer: While we hope to implement this feature at a later date, you currently cannot modify previous requests.  However, you can input multiple requests into the system, and requests you previously made will be cached (and thus will not need to be processed again, and be returned to you quicker).

help.question: Why are some years not listed in the filter for the aid dataset I selected?
help.answer: Our filters are dynamically generated based on thhe underlying aid data and some datasets simply do not have projects for all years.

help.question: Where can I find more details on the extract methods used (e.g., mean, sum, count, as well as aid data extractions)
help.answer: You can read our paper HERE or visit geo.aiddata.org for links to our code and additional resources and documentation.

welcome.title: Welcome to geo(query)
welcome.content:
Get a simple-to-use file where every row is a unit of analysis and every column is the data you want - no special training required.

Choose a country and a unit of analysis.

Select and customize satellite and other spatial datasets from across disciplines.

We will email you the data for use in Excel, STATA, R, or your favorite program as soon as it is ready - 100% free.
welcome.content4:
A tool to access terabytes of geospatial data in a research ready format

Choose a country and a unit of analysis.

Select and customize satellite and other spatial datasets from across disciplines.

We will email you the data for use in Excel, STATA, R, or your favorite program as soon as it is ready - 100% free.
welcome.content3:
A tool to access terabytes of geospatial data in a research ready format - allowing you to spend less time wrangling data, and more time analyzing it.

Choose from a curated collection of geospatial units of analysis including administrative boundaries, grids, and more.

Select and customize datasets from numerous disciplines and topics (international aid, climate and environment, conflict, economics, human welfare, and more).

We will email you the data as soon as it is ready - 100% free.
welcome.content2:
Join spatial data on aid with other datasets for use with your favorite program (including Excel, SPSS, STATA, R and more) - no training required.

Select geographic boundaries (country, census unit, and others) you want data for.

Select the data you want for those boundaries.

Check your email for a permanent link to download your data.

Repeat for as many areas as you want, for free.
welcome.content1:
A tool to leverage terabytes of geospatial data, helping you spend less time wrangling data and more time analyzing it.

Access geospatial data curated from publicly available sources.

Easily filter and join datsets to get the information you want.

Check your email for a permanent link to download your data.

det.boundary_selection_intro: Select a boundary on the left to begin.
data_selection_intro: then filter using options on the right
add to your request when done and select another dataset

submitted.title: Your submission is now being processed
submitted.content: You can review your current and past requests on this page, or start a new request.

status.submitted: We have received your request and it is enqueued for processing.
status.prepared: Your request is enqueued for processing.
status.processing: We are currently processing your request.  This can take minutes to hours.
status.completed: Your request has been completed and can be downloaded.

content: The database and derived products produced by this tool are governed by the license available at http://geo.aiddata.org/license ('the geo license').  By clicking submit you agree to the terms of the geo license, which are summarized as:

Attribute: You must attribute any public use of the database, or works produced from the database, in the manner specified in the license. For any use or redistribution of the database, or works produced from it, you must make clear to others the license of the database and keep intact any notices on the original database.
To Share: To copy, distribute and use the database.
To Create: To produce works from the database.
To Adapt: To modify, transform and build upon the database.

This is not a license. It is simply a handy reference for understanding the ODC-BY 1.0 â€” it is a human-readable expression of some of its key terms. This summary has no legal value, and its contents do not appear in the actual license. Read the full ODC-BY 1.0 license text at geo.aiddata.org/license for the exact terms that apply.

det.citation: By clicking submit below, you agree to the terms and conditions listed and agree to cite the following in any and all applications of the extracted datasets: Goodman, S., BenYishay, A., Runfola, D., 2016. Overview of the geo Framework. AidData. Available online at http://geo.aiddata.org. DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.28363.59686

fields.description: Recipients ISO3 of project, usually corresponding to a country.
Years of projects, determined by years of transactions associated with projects.
Place name type descriptor(link to iati/geonames).

Precision codes for project locations (link to iati).

help.question: How do I cite?
help.answer: Goodman, S., BenYishay, A., Runfola, D., 2016. Overview of the geo. Framework. AidData. Available online at http://geo.aiddata.org/docs/. DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.19140.63363

welcome.title: Welcome to geo.query
welcome.content:
A tool to leverage terabytes of geospatial data, helping you spend less time wrangling data and more time analyzing it.

Access geospatial data curated from publicly available sources.

Easily filter and join datsets to get the information you want.

Check your email for a permanent link to download your data.

submitted.title: Your request has been submitted
submitted.content: You will receive an email shortly when your request items have been added into the processing queue. After your request has finished processing, you will receive another email with a download link.

status.submitted: Request has been added to the queue and is awaiting processing
status.prepared: Request has been received and prepared for processing.

content: The geo framework and geo.query tool are available under the ##### license.

When using data provided by geo.query, users are required to cite individual datasets used (see accompanying documentation for dataset specific citation information) in addition to the geo.query tool.
By clicking submit you accept these terms.
